title: Rihanna wears wig for colorful shoot in New York
text:
She is an actress, a signer, a fashion icon and first and foremost a style chameleon.
Rihanna has never been afraid to change up her look and, on Tuesday, she transformed once again.
The 28-year-old looked like she had just stepped out of the pages of a graphic novel as she posed up for an early morning shoot in New York for Paper Magazine.
Chameleon chic: Rihanna has never been afraid to change up her look and, on Tuesday, she transformed once again in New York
While Rihanna has been working long hours on the set of Ocean's Eight, the star brought the fierceness in the early hours of Tuesday morning.
She posed up a storm despite it being 3am, first spending time inside a Lower East Side bodega before emerging looking completely different to pose up against a graffiti'd wall.
The colorful spray painted wall was no match for the star and her extra colorful look.
After donning a number of outfits inside the corner store, she emerged in a bright green wig.
Green with envy: The 28-year-old looked like she had just stepped out of the pages of a graphic novel as she posed up for an early morning shoot for Paper Magazine
No sleep needed: While Rihanna has been working long hours on the set of Ocean's Eight, the star brought the fierceness in the early hours of Tuesday morning

Rihanna isn't one to do things by halves.
Not only is the superstar singer sporting a green wig and two bags on a belt around her waist in this photoshoot for Paper magazine, she's also rocking a pair of sky high platform heels and this feather trim multi-coloured dress.
We love the Mondrian-style stripes on this midi dress, which is by Proenza Schouler. It hails from the SS17 collection and we've already spotted Sienna Miller wearing it, so you know it's a must try trend this season.
The good news is it's now available to buy at Neiman Marcus so click (right) if you've got £3645 burning a hole in your pocket. The long sleeves and midi length are super flattering, so get a piece of the Proenza Schouler pie ASAP.

The hair piece - which had bangs and fell in haphazard waves past her shoulders - made her look like a fashion superhero.
And perhaps she has superhero powers, as the Work singer did even seem to notice Manhattan's bitter cold which dropped to just above freezing during the early morning shoot.
The star's legs were given no protection against the cold with the star wearing a knitted long sleeved dress.

The over-the-knee dress was made from a non-uniform pattern of rectangular of red, blue, white and yellow and had a fringed hem.
The shoot's stylist paired the dress with perfectly coordinating - but not warm - red platforms with red and black straps.
The look was finished off with some oversized accessories, namely a saddlebag-inspired belt, a plastic chain necklace and dangling white earrings.

Instead of an avant garde look, Rih wore just a light eye shadow with some dark colored lipstick.
While the Diamonds star did not show that she was cold, as soon as they were done with the look, she made sure to quickly pop on a padded jacket.

Rihanna wore a number of wigs during the shoot, and was seen earlier wearing a big purple ponytail hairpiece.
She was also seen wearing a head-to-toe camouflage ensemble featuring a Vetements X Canadian Goose jacket but added some sparkle jewel-encrusted heels.
Photographer by Inez van Lamsweerde who was no doubt was shooting with collaborator Vinoodh Matadi. Together they are known for hyper-stylized editorial shoots.

Rihanna has been very busy of late shooting the female-led fourth installment of the Ocean's casino heist series.
The anthology was made modern-day famous by George Clooney and Brad Pitt's Ocean's Eleven, which was a remake of the rat pack's 1960 original version by the same name.
Rihanna will appear in Ocean's Eight alongside several of the greats for her role in the film, with this edition's all-girls team of thieves led by Sandra Bullock and Cate Blanchett.
